trans-unit.source: Represents a collection of <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.CustomError"></xref> objects.
This class cannot be inherited.
The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.CustomErrorCollection> type allows access to the `error` elements of the `customErrors` section element collection.
It belongs to a group that includes the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.CustomError>, <xref:System.Web.Configuration.CustomErrorsMode>, and <xref:System.Web.Configuration.CustomErrorsSection>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.CustomErrorCollection"></xref> class.
The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.CustomErrorCollection.%23ctor%2A> constructor is not intended to be used directly from your code.
It is called by the ASP.NET configuration system.
You obtain an instance of the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.CustomErrorCollection> class by using the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.CustomErrorsSection.Errors%2A> property.
Adds a <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.CustomError"></xref> object to the collection.

Before adding a custom error to the collection, you must create a <xref:System.Web.Configuration.CustomError> error object and initialize the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.CustomError.Redirect%2A> and <xref:System.Web.Configuration.CustomError.StatusCode%2A> properties.
The <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.CustomError"></xref> object to add already exists in the collection or the collection is read only.
Returns an array of the keys for all of the configuration elements contained in this <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.CustomErrorCollection"></xref>.
An array containing the keys for all of the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.CustomError"></xref> objects contained in this <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.CustomErrorCollection"></xref>.
Removes all <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.CustomError"></xref> objects from the collection.

The result of updating the configuration file after calling the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.CustomErrorCollection.Clear%2A> method is dependent upon the <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationSaveMode> chosen.
To update the configuration file, you use one of these two overloads: <xref:System.Configuration.Configuration.Save%2A> and <xref:System.Configuration.Configuration.Save%2A>.
Calling <xref:System.Configuration.Configuration.Save%2A> is equivalent to calling <xref:System.Configuration.Configuration.Save%2A>.
If you use the <xref:System.Configuration.Configuration.Save%2A>.method, the following conditions apply.

If you pass a <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationSaveMode.Full> or <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationSaveMode.Modified> parameter value, then a `clear` element is inserted into the `clientTarget` section of the configuration file at the current hierarchy level.

If you pass the <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationSaveMode.Minimal> parameter value, a series of `remove` elements are added to the [clientTarget Element (ASP.NET Settings Schema)](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/17a0fa6e-a065-49cc-b900-ef73eda6a922) of the configuration file at the current hierarchy level.
Each removes all references to an `add` element defined in a parent configuration file at a higher level in the hierarchy.

When you use <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationSaveMode.Minimal>, there is one additional property on the collection that affects what gets serialized to the configuration file: <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationElementCollection.EmitClear%2A>, which is `false` by default.
The following conditions apply.

If the <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationElementCollection.EmitClear%2A> set to `true`, `clear` element is inserted into the `clientTarget` section of the configuration file at the current hierarchy level.
This removes all references to the `add` elements defined in the parent configuration files at higher levels in the hierarchy.

If the <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationElementCollection.EmitClear%2A> flag is set to `false`, the `clear` element is removed from the `clientTarget` section of the configuration file at the current hierarchy level, if it exists.

The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.CustomErrorCollection.Clear%2A> method actually deletes the `add` elements defined in the `clientTarget` section of the configuration file at the current hierarchy level.
It also removes all references to the add elements defined in the parent configuration files at higher levels in the hierarchy.
The `add` elements are not deleted from the `clientTarget` section of the parent configuration files.
The type of the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.CustomErrorCollection"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Configuration.ConfigurationElementCollectionType"></xref> of this collection.
Gets the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.CustomError"></xref> object with the specified status code.
The HTTP status code associated with the custom error.
The <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.CustomError"></xref> object with the specified status code.
Gets the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.CustomError"></xref> object with the specified index.
The collection index of the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.CustomError"></xref> object.
The <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.CustomError"></xref> with the specified index.
Gets the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.CustomErrorCollection"></xref> key at the specified index.
The collection key's index.
The <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.CustomErrorCollection"></xref> key at the specified index.
Gets the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.CustomError"></xref> with the specified index.
The collection error's index.
The <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.CustomError"></xref> at the specified index.
Gets the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.CustomError"></xref> with the specified status code.
The HTTP status code.
The <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.CustomError"></xref> with the specified status code.
Removes a <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.CustomError"></xref> object from the collection.
The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.CustomErrorCollection.Remove%2A> method inserts a `remove` element into the `customErrors` section of the configuration file at the current hierarchy level.
This removes the reference to the `add` element defined in the parent configuration files at higher levels in the hierarchy.
The `add` elements are not deleted from the parent configuration files.
The `remove` element merely deactivates them.
However, the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.CustomErrorCollection.Remove%2A> method does actually delete them at the current hierarchy level.
The HTTP status code associated with the custom error.
Removes a <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.CustomError"></xref> object at the specified index location from the collection.
The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.CustomErrorCollection.RemoveAt%2A> method inserts a `remove` element into the `customErrors` section of the configuration file at the current hierarchy level.
This is to remove the reference to the `add` element defined in the parent configuration files at higher-level in the hierarchy.
**Note** The `add` elements are not deleted from the parent configuration files.
They are merely deactivated.
However, the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.CustomErrorCollection.RemoveAt%2A> method does actually delete them at the current hierarchy level.
The collection index of the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.CustomError"></xref> object to remove.
Adds the specified <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.CustomError"></xref> to the collection.
This specified error replaces the current configuration error element.
The <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.CustomError"></xref> to add to the collection.
